name: Monkey Mia Dolphin Resort

reviews.text: Monkey Mia is in the sticks!! It takes 9hrs drive from Perth and the closest 'large town' is Geraldton a mere 4hr, 250+ mile drive!
reviews.title: Great at The Mia...5* for us!
watch out for reception
reviews.text: So the logistics on keeping this wonderful resort going is hard
...but they do it. No, it's not 5*, but not 3* either, somewhere in the middle. But it rocked our boat!
reviews.title: So So At Monkey Mia
once but not again !
reviews.text: We stayed in a Garden Villa, which had a view of the beach!!?! It was

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: very comfortable, like a Travel Inn in the UK! Great for a 4 night stop. Before coming reading the reviews we were thinking of cancelling, but after speaking to Mrs Sky we went for it and aren't we glad we did!
reviews.title: Simple accomodation

reviews.text: This is very expensive and very basic BUT after all that driving you have to sometimes take a break and we think this is as good a place to do that as anywhere else. The rooms are very basic, almost verging on youth hostel standard but are 5* prices but walking onto the beach within 5 seconds of leaving your room is what you are paying for. We saw the dolphins up close but if you are after that kind of experience I would recommend going to the USA Everglades/ The keys, where you can swim with them. We had beautiful sunsets and a great time enjoying the little boats where you lie on your belly and look through the glass bottom at the stingray's and sea snakes below you.....no sharks "!!!!!!!. Chill & relax.
reviews.title: Dolphins !!!

reviews.text: We stayed at this "resort" for 2 nights, by the time we left that seemed like too long! We paid $195 per night for a flea pit with dirty fraying carpets and a filthy room. We should have known there was trouble ahead when a large notice in the office proclaimed that people vacating the resort early would not receive a refund under any circumstances! The only positive thing about the stay was the opportunity to observe the dolphins and the resort seems to exploit this as much as they can. As with previous reviews the Bough Shed restaurant was a disgrace serving overpriced rubbish. It took 15 minutes to remove our dirty plates even though there were only 4 couples in the restaurant. If you want to see the dolphins then my advice is to buy a $6 day ticket and stay in the much friendler town of Denham.
reviews.title: Over priced dump

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Dolphin resort for 3 nights in mid December 2006.
reviews.title: Nice Beach but ...

likes.disliked: — The resorts restaurant and early closing during off-peak of small shop

reviews.text: The accomodation is of a reasonable standard and there are lots of super views of the sea. On the negative side our particular room was above a communal cooking and wash area so there it wasnt the quietest accomodation we stayed in.
reviews.title: Should have stayed longer!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: By far the worst meal that both my wife and myself have ever had on our travels was dished up after a drawn out wait in the resorts restaurant. Staff appeared over worked in the half full establishment so Ive no idea what was going on in the kitchens.
reviews.title: Fantastic!!!!

likes.disliked: — The room was a bit basic.

reviews.text: Ignore the cynics, the ones who tell you you'll travel a 1000 miles to be ripped off to see a few dolphins swim up to your feet. We stayed at the Monkey Mia Dolphin Resort, Aug 04 and what a fantastic time. OK, so the accomodation is basic but it is clean - how much time would you want to spend in your room anyway. There is spread out accomodation but the best places are the ones on the beachfront, a little more money, but worth it. You'll wake up in the morning, and if lucky like us, the first thing you'll see is a dolphin swimming past. Basic yes, but a fantasic location. Very frienly and helpful staff. Fairly good restaurant (but book asap to check what time tour groups will be eating).
reviews.title: Ignore the cynics

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had actually booked into & paid for a campsite in Denham, but after driving the 30km to the resort & checking out the facilities, we decided that we'd stay here instead, in spite of having paid for the other place!
reviews.title: If you're camping, stay here & not in Denham

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you're coming to Monkey Mia, then you really want to stay at the resort otherwise you're going to spend a lot of time, energy & money driving back and forth from the town.
reviews.title: Lovely Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For campers, the resort has everything. Lots of facilities, a swimming pool & a hot tub (be warned that the bore water will stain your swimmers! they also use bore water in the washing machines so you want to avoid doing your washing here too otherwise everything will end up stained). It also has a small supermarket & an onsite cafe/restaurant if you don't want to use the excellent campers kitchen.
reviews.title: Great place to stop and see the dolphins

likes.disliked: — Its a long drive to reach it

reviews.text: Monkey Mia itself is an excellent place to stay, besides the dolphins, it's just a really relaxing place & the boat cruises are fantastic. We have very happy memories of staying here as part of a longer WA camping trip.
reviews.title: Beachfront Luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only downside is that it's really popular & can get quite busy so if you're there in school holidays get there early & take ear plugs to drown out the noise of the Germans who have camped pretty much on top of you!
reviews.title: Beach Front visual luxury

likes.disliked: — Length of time it took to get there

aka: Monkey Mia Dolphin Hotel Monkey Mia
